title: Brian Vogler
text:
Brian "Chookie" Vogler (30 May 1932 in <a href="Ipswich%2C%20Queensland">Ipswich, Queensland</a> – 6 May 2009 in <a href="Gold%20Coast%2C%20Queensland">Gold Coast, Queensland</a>) was an Australian international <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> and coal miner.
Biography.
He spent his childhood in <a href="North%20Ipswich%2C%20Queensland">North Ipswich</a> attending local Catholic schools before becoming a coal miner, a profession he followed for 43 years.
Vogler began his sporting career as a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer before switching to football. He played senior football in Queensland for Blackstone and Hellenic during the 1950s and 1960s. Later he would be a competitive cricketer and lawn bowler.
Although selected in the Australian squad that competed at the <a href="Association%20football%20at%20the%201956%20Summer%20Olympics">1956 Melbourne Olympic Games</a>, Brian didn't make his international debut until after the Games in a friendly match against <a href="India%20national%20football%20team">India</a> at the <a href="Sydney%20Sports%20Ground">Sydney Sports Ground</a> in December of the same year.
Vogler, <a href="Socceroo">Socceroo</a> number 158, scored on debut in a 1–7 loss to the Indians. He played two more matches for Australia against New Zealand in 1958 scoring his second A-international goal at Carlaw Park in a 2-all draw. In 1959 he scored again for Australia in a B-International against a touring <a href="Heart%20of%20Midlothian%20F.C.">Heart of Midlothian</a> team. In later life he was a competitive <a href="lawn%20bowls">lawn bowler</a>.
Personal life.
Married to Margaret. They had six children: Mark, Gary, Christine, <a href="Peter%20Vogler">Peter</a> (an Australian representative in baseball at two Olympics), Matthew and Anne.
